Came across the following ticket that was discussing about this matter:
* [Attachments not recoreded in Change History|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-16785]

It might be quite confusing as the *initial* creation of a ticket that has an attachment included in it is not recorded in the *History* tab. However, the next attachment included in the ticket is recorded. The only way to check on this is through the *Manage Attachments* option. Is this an intended behavior? The following screenshot(s) explain:

* _Creating a new issue with the attachment {{jira.jpg}} attached to the issue_
!create_issue_1.JPG!

!create_issue_2.JPG!

* _Checking the *Activity* tab and *History* tab, nothing is recorded_
!activity_tab.JPG!

!history_tab.JPG!

* _Checking through *Manage Attachments*, you are able to see the details of the attachment_
!manage_attachment.JPG!

* _After including another attachment {{greenhopper.png}} to the ticket, then you can see the changes_
!activity_tab_2.JPG!

!history_tab_2.JPG!
fields.summary: Initial Attachment history to be recorded either in History / Activity tab

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32842].
  {panel}

h3. The problem:
Currently the table *jiraissue* has no restriction to insertion of null values into the column *pkey*. This situation can lead to problems as the one described in this [KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+throws+NullPointerException+while+re-indexing+due+to+pkey+with+null+value].

See desc table:
{code}
mysql> desc jiraissue;
+----------------------+---------------+------+-----+---------+-------+
| Field                | Type          | Null | Key | Default | Extra |
+----------------------+---------------+------+-----+---------+-------+
| ID                   | decimal(18,0) | NO   | PRI | NULL    |       |
| pkey                 | varchar(255)  | YES  | UNI | NULL    |       |
| PROJECT              | decimal(18,0) | YES  | MUL | NULL    |       |
| REPORTER             | varchar(255)  | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| ASSIGNEE             | varchar(255)  | YES  | MUL | NULL    |       |
| issuetype            | varchar(255)  | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| SUMMARY              | varchar(255)  | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| DESCRIPTION          | longtext      | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| ENVIRONMENT          | longtext      | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| PRIORITY             | varchar(255)  | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| RESOLUTION           | varchar(255)  | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| issuestatus          | varchar(255)  | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| CREATED              | datetime      | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| UPDATED              | datetime      | YES  | MUL | NULL    |       |
| DUEDATE              | datetime      | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| RESOLUTIONDATE       | datetime      | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| VOTES                | decimal(18,0) | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| WATCHES              | decimal(18,0) | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| TIMEORIGINALESTIMATE | decimal(18,0) | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| TIMEESTIMATE         | decimal(18,0) | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| TIMESPENT            | decimal(18,0) | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| WORKFLOW_ID          | decimal(18,0) | YES  | MUL | NULL    |       |
| SECURITY             | decimal(18,0) | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| FIXFOR               | decimal(18,0) | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| COMPONENT            | decimal(18,0) | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
+----------------------+---------------+------+-----+---------+-------+
25 rows in set (0.46 sec)
{code}

h3. Proposed fix:

The create table script could include the *NOT NULL* parameter:
{code:sql}
CREATE TABLE jiraissue (
ID decimal(18,0) NOT NULL,
pkey varchar(255) NOT NULL,
...
{code}
fields.summary: The table jiraissue should not permit null value for pkey column

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32836].
  {panel}

Reproduction sequence:
1. Pick up an issue that is visible to user 1 and not visible to user 2. Let's say it has ID 10111.
2. User 1 creates saved filter {{issue = 10111}} and shares with user 2.
3. User 2 opens the saved filter.

Obsreved: no errors, no result.
Expected: error message that issue does not exist.

The expectation is set by the case when issue key is used instead of issue ID.

Speculation:
As with JRA-32772, this is because if query string equals saved filter string, it is not validated ({{DefaultIssueTableService.getIssueTable()}}). Here, after sanitization the query remains the same, and is not validated.
fields.summary: Lack of query revalidation for saved filters in Issue Navigator leads to unexplained empty query result

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32788].
  {panel}

The @mentions feature is handy for bringing arbitrary folks into a conversation about an issue.  If folks mentioned in comments do not become watchers of an issue, however, they can miss subsequent comments.  This behavior could become a real problem if multiple people are mentioned in a comment.

Here's the scenario:
* Enter a comment in JIRA, @mentioning multiple individuals.
* One of the mentioned individuals gets the email and visits JIRA to enter a reply.
* Unless that individual mentions the same set of folks as in the original comment, none of the other individuals mentioned in the original comment will see the reply.  They will be out of the loop.

With the current mechanism, anyone mentioned in a comment needs to be sure they read all comments that were posted after the comment in which they were mentioned, to see if they've missed some replies from other participants.  This could be confusing for users and encourage them to keep using email to communicate rather than JIRA. :(

I can see the rationale for postponing the watch event until they visit the issue.  This behavior implements a sort of 'opt-in' system.  Unfortunately, it could result in users missing out on parts of a conversation.
fields.summary: Add @mentions to watcher list on comment entry

  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

- Create a some issues on a given project, they should stay in the Open status
- In the issue navigator, perform a search for all issues in the Open status
- Save this search
- Add the Filter results gadget to a dashboard and select the filter created in the previous step
- The issues will be displayed in the gadget
- Now, go to the Statuses Administration session
- Rename the "Open" status to "test status"
- Go to the dashboard again. The gadget will break with the following message:

{noformat}
The selected filter filter-16550 has an error: The value 'test status' does not exist for the field 'status'.
{noformat}

If you take a look at the workflows, everywhere the status Open was used, it was replaced to the new value "test status", but the filters remain with the old name and break.

The filter should save the status ID instead of the Status name, and it shouldn't be necessary for the user to do that.
fields.summary: Filter results gadget throws The selected filter filter-16550 has an error: The value 'test status' does not exist for the field 'status'. upon changing status name

h3. Problem

A lot of users need either to remove the default "Name" and "Email" from the Issue collector or set them as required. Neither of these options are currently available to be configured without customization.

There is no workaround for JIRA OnDemand.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32772].
  {panel}

Reproduction sequence:

# Create and save filter H = {{priority = Critical}}.
# Create and save filter F = {{filter = H and not summary ~ clone}}.
# Create and save filter G = {{filter = F and assignee is empty}}.
# Click filter H in the "Favourite Filters" section in the Issue Navigator.
# Click filter G in the same section.

Observe: error message 
{panel}Field 'filter' with value 'F' matches filter 'F' and causes a cyclical reference, this query can not be executed and should be edited.{panel}

Expected: no error message.

Speculation:

When {{SavedFilterClauseValidator}} checks whether any nested saved filters reference the current saved filter, it uses {{sessionSearchRequestManager.getCurrentObject()}}, which doesn't get updated on step 5 and returns {{H}}. Since {{G(F(H()))}} references {{H}},  the wrong error message is displayed.

Note that this problem manifests only if saved filters are revalidated. Revalidation does not happen if the query in the Issue Navigator {{equals()}} the query of the saved filter ({{DefaultIssueTableService.getIssueTable()}}). Due to the strange way {{Query.equals()}} is implemented (comparing query strings), it happens always if the saved filter features lowercase {{and}} (the saved version has uppercase {{AND}}, and the version in the Issue Navigator has lowercase {{and}}) and does not happen if the filter's query string coincides with the generated string.

Reproduced on JIRA 5.2.6 (Standalone) and OnDemand ([https://bukkit.atlassian.net]).
fields.summary: SessionSearchRequestManager.getCurrentObject() is not updated when the user clicks another saved filter in the Issue Navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32764].
  {panel}

If a ticket is moved, there is a link that automatically redirects from the original ticket key to the new one.  If JIRA's ticket key counter is reset, it does not check to see if this link already exists, before adding the ticket key.

Tested on JIRA 5.2.11

Steps:
* Create issue in a project (example: TST-1)
* Move TST-1 to another project
** Let's say the new key is MOV-2
** access TST-1 will redirect to MOV-2
* Reset JIRA's counter for the TST project
** aka the pcounter in database
* Create new issue under project TST
* JIRA assigns it to TST-1
* The original link between TST-1 and MOV-2 is broken

Expected behaviour is a check to see if the ticket number is reserved for a link.  For example, if the issue was not moved, you would get an error like so:
{code}
2013-04-16 10:10:10,592 http-8443-Processor241 ERROR username 36372x847927x3 6a9lyn https://jira-server-name/secure/CreateSubTaskIssueDetails.jspa [atlassian.jira.project.DefaultProjectManager] Existing issue found for key TST-1. Incrementing key.
{code}
fields.summary: Issue keys can overwrite keys of moved tickets, overwriting the moved link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32751].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

In certain circumstances some fields in the Issue Navigator are greyed out when they don't need to be.

h3. Environment

* Mac OS X 10.7.5.
* PostgreSQL 9.1.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add Project A & Project B.
# Add the same version names to both projects.
# In the Project dropdown, select 2 Projects (Project A and Project B)
# In the "More Criteria" field, search for "Fix Version"

h3. Expected Results

The fix versions that are identical are selectable.

h3. Actual Results

Although both Projects are sharing same version numbers, the Fix Version is greyed out and cannot be added.

h3. Notes

# In the filters, select one and only one project from the "Project" dropdown (example: Project A)
# In the "More Criteria", select Fix Version (--> This works)
# Now, from the Fix Version dropdown, select all the versions that you need (5.1, 5.2,...)
# Then only, from the "Project" dropdown, add the 2nd Project (example: Project B)
# The correct issues are returned
# If you go to "Switch to advanced" the JQL query is 
{code}project in ("Project A", "Project B") AND fixVersion in ("5.1", "5.2"){code}

This leads to all sorts of fun as well, try:

# Select Project A.
# Select Fix Version.
# Unselect Project.
# Project A & Project B are returned & Fix Version is greyed.
# Remove fix version as an option.
# Select Project A.
# Try to add Fix Version. It's greyed out - to fix you need to refresh the page.
fields.summary: Fix version is greyed out in the 5.2 Issue Navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32750].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When using the *Default Reporter* in mail, it will append the from address to the description of the issue as per the [Creating Issues and Comments from Email|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+Issues+and+Comments+from+Email] docs:

{quote}
* When an issue is created and this option is specified, the email message's From: field address is appended in a brief message at the end of the issue's Description field, so that the sender can be identified.
{quote}

For example:

{quote}
Contents
[Created via e-mail received from: "Captain Planet" <captain.planet@example.com>]
{quote}

h3. Environment

* Gmail SMTP/IMAP
* Google Web Client
* PostgreSQL 9.1
* Mac OS X 10.7.5
*Added on 9th July 2014:
* JIRA OnDemand
* Mac Mail Client
* JIRA 6.1.7 and 6.2.7 tested also affected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add a new user, e.g.: {{defaultreporter}}.
# Create a mail handler with the following:
{quote}
Strip Quotes: false
Default Reporter: Defaultreporter
Catch Email Address: email@example.com
Bulk: delete
Forward Email: email@example.com
Create Users: false
Notify Users: true
CC Assignee: false
CC Watchers: true
{quote}
# Send an email to that mailbox.

h3. Expected Results

It creates the email and appends the "Created via e-mail received from" section.

h3. Actual Results

It does not append those details.

h3. Notes
Do try the following if you found the reporter to be having mixed case. It should only affect the earlier version.
{quote}
To workaround this, change the reporter to lower-case to match the user, e.g.: {{defaultreporter}}.
{quote}

But if this does not work for you, comment on this ticket on the JIRA version being used.

h4. Update by [~rgee] 9th July 2014:
There are some reported cases that it also affects the user that does not contain mixed case username. Tested able to replicate on my environment. Additional information being added onto this ticket.
fields.summary: Mail handler doesn't append the FROM address

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32745].
  {panel}

It would be extremely useful if the Jira Create Issue dialog searched not only on Project Name, but also on Project Key when the user is typing to get a match on the Project. It can be extremely frustrating, time-wasting, and dangerous when a Project Name (just a Description field, right?) is changed and email notification of this event is not sent by the person making the change. Why? Because the user will probably not find the Project being looked for since it has been renamed.

Example:

Project Name: Foobar
Project Key: FOOB

Project Foobar is renamed by the Project Lead to "Ribitz" for reasons only understood by the Project Lead.

Another user goes to create an issue in Foobar, starts typing "foob" and nothing pops out! The user then looks around a little and doesn't see Foobar. What's going on? Sound the alarm! Who deleted the Foobar Jira Project?

If the Project matching was also done on the Project Key, the user would have found Ribitz right away, been confused for a second, and then realized what had happened. Or at least the user would have been lead in the right direction.
fields.summary: Create Issue should also search on Project Key, not just Project Name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32712].
  {panel}

When you have more than 1 favorite dashboards, their names are listed in a sidebar that steels a whole bunch of useful space from your dashboard. This waist of space is even more painful if you use  your screen vertically.

Two options to solve this:
* Add a undock button like you did for the brand new 6.0 issue navigator
* Give an option to completely hide the sidebar, since you can access your different dashboards from the pulldown menu (the sidebar is redundant with the menu and not really needed).
fields.summary: Make dashboard sidebar undock-able or remove sidebar totally

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32711].
  {panel}

After performing some tests, we could confirm on the following behavior when it comes to *Dashboard* sharing:
* As Project Lead, the user is not able to share a Dashboard that he / she owns to the specific roles within his / her own project.
* As Project Lead and with the role of Project Administrator, the user is only able to share the Dashboard that he / she owns to other Project Administrators, not to other roles within his / her own project.

This is true as you are only able to share the dashboards / filters only to the role(s) that you belong to. If you want to share it with all the project role(s), ensure yourself included in *ALL* the roles. Just because you are in the *JIRA Administrators* group, it doesn't entitle you to have the ability to share the dashboard / filters to other roles. *JIRA System Administrator* should have that power since they control the whole *JIRA* itself.

However, here is the users explanation on how this issue should be looked at, from a different perspective:
{quote}
My view on a project lead is that he/she should be able to decide the accessibility of info freely within his/hers project to any level of project members without having to be involved into the deepest levels of the project. He/she should be able to sure that work is progressed/done according to the original plan. Project lead IS the utter responsible of the success of the project and should be able to give resources to the project members without any further settings but to be set as project lead.

Of course there might be some security issues which comes with this but they are at the most very remote and dependent on other settings in that case.

Of course getting the project lead level should not override other permission levels. Better safe than sorry.
{quote}

Any thoughts on this? Perhaps this can be considered in the future release of *JIRA*?
fields.summary: Project Lead limitation on Dashboard Sharing

fields.description: One of our Project's JIRA issue sequencing has gone crazy.  This is one of our smallest Project with about 156 issues, yet now every time we try and create an issue is assigning new numbers in the thousands (ex:  1149, 2259, 3349, etc.).  I suspect that we will need to get into the database to reset the sequence accordingly, but need your direction before going into a Production JIRA to change the database.
fields.summary: Jira Project Issue Sequence Number is Incorrect

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32702].
  {panel}

After the removal of a project on JIRA, the project is not being automatically removed from Bamboo. If the new project has the same project key, the project name is not being updated too.

Steps to reproduce:
1.Create a project in JIRA (TEST)
2.This project will appear in project selection when creating a new Plan in Bamboo.
3.Delete TEST from JIRA and create a new project "New Test", with same project key (TEST)
4. Try to create a new plan, the old name will remains, because Bamboo is not checking the project name or bringing it from JIRA.
fields.summary: OnDemand isn't properly removing/updating the projects in Bamboo after JIRA Project removal.

fields.description: We want to move my bugs from Bugzilla to JIRA. But i unable to move my bugs description and comment from bugzilla to JIRA.
fields.summary: Unable to move my bugs description or comments from bugzilla to JIRA.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32699].
  {panel}

1) Install JIRA standalone by unzipping it into a directory.
2) Run config.bat / config.sh and set the JIRA Home directory and database.. Save and exit.
3) Start JIRA.

It jumps straight to step 2 of the setup wizard, skipping the option to pick the server language. 

This is unrelated to the recent 6.0 work to rewrite the setup process and also happens on 5.2.0. I suspect it's been this way since 4.4.
fields.summary: Using config.bat / config.sh to configure JIRA Home/database also skips language selection

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32697].
  {panel}

At the moment, a user is able to [configure the maximum attachment size|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA052/Configuring+File+Attachments] through JIRA Administration.  There are times when it is convenient to set a limit of the attachment size for a particular project. 

One scenario:
# User can attach a file for a Support Project up to 50MB
# User can only attach file for the Recruitment Project up to 10MB
fields.summary: Allow users to configure the attachment size per project basis

fields.description:

As of now, the [Average Age Report|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Average+Age+Report] are configured to take on either a *Project* or a *Saved Filter*.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32695].
  {panel}

As companies grow in both projects and people administration teams must grow to service business needs, however giving full administration access can lead to configuration accidents or general loss of control for they system.

Many complex web applications have the ability of creating roles in order to assign different sets of permissions.

For example, just because I want someone to be able to create new projects it doesn't mean I want him to be able to change the user directory configuration or be able to install plugins.

An easy (and good enough) implementation would be to just hide administration sections per role created.

Having the ability to define roles would allow me to say, for example:

- System administrator: Full access
- Administrator: Access to workflows, permisions & issue level security, custom fields, screens, projects, etc. This role wont have access to System or Plugins settings, but will have access to Projects, Users and and Issues. However, no access to User Directories
- Project administrator: Access to Users (but not User Directories) and Projects

Having the option to only give full access or none affects our decision as a company whether to or not to fully move to Jira: we already have it in our organization but it is only being used in some geographical locations. 

Some teams currently use Assembla or other tools just because they cannot get the access they need from the Jira administrators. Much of this has to do with the inability to create workflows and custom fields. IT doesn't want to give access to everybody for obvious security reasons and that our Jira instance is a big production system, and any disruption of service that may be cause due to a misconfiguration can lead to business disruption or even downtime.
fields.summary: RBAC for granular control of administration section

fields.description: I would like to be able to set the default issue security setting that will be set when issues are added to the system. Currently the issue are being added as a reporter set to my account and anyone can see the issues unless I manually set them to a higher setting.
fields.summary: Issue Collection Default Security Setting
